title: ICE: Mismatched trait bounds for static trait methods leads to ICE rather than error

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

body:
``` rust
use std::fmt::Show;

trait Something {
    fn yay<T: Show>(_: Option<Self>, thing: &[T]) -> String {
        format!("{}", thing)
    }
}

struct X { data: u32 }

impl Something for X {
    // Changing `T: Str` into `T: Show` compiles fine
    fn yay<T: Str>(_:Option<X>, thing: &[T]) -> String {
        format!("{:s}", thing[0])
    }
}

fn main() {
    let arr = &["one", "two", "three"];
    println!("{}", Something::yay(None::<X>, arr))
}
```

